thread.title: American Eagle Flight Strikes Deer Shortly After Taking Off
thread.title_full: American Eagle Flight Strikes Deer Shortly After Taking Off

author: CBS Philly
title: American Eagle Flight Strikes Deer Shortly After Taking Off
text:
American Eagle Flight Strikes Deer Shortly After Taking Off February 15, 2017 2:10 PM Filed Under: American Eagle , Deer File photo of an American Eagle plane. (credit: DANIEL SLIM/AFP/Getty Images) 
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (CBS/AP) — Authorities say an American Eagle flight struck a deer shortly after taking off from the Charlotte, North Carolina, international airport, forcing it to turn around and abort a flight to Gulfport, Mississippi. 
The Federal Aviation Administration said in a statement that the pilot of Flight 5320 declared an emergency shortly before noon Wednesday. 
TV stations showed damage to one of the right front wing flaps of the CRJ700 jet, and emergency personnel sprayed foam on the aircraft as a precaution. 
CBS News’ Kris Van Cleave reports fuel was leaking from the plane after the incident and that passengers exited on the runway. . @AmericanAir 5320, struck deer on takeoff from CLT. CRJ-700 w/44 passengers and 4 crew. Plane had fuel leaking, passengers exited on runway 
— Kris Van Cleave (@krisvancleave) February 15, 2017 
No injuries were reported. The 44 passengers aboard the flight deplaned by stairs and were seen boarding buses to return to the terminal.
